title: Ron Johnson’s Oshkosh Heresy
sub_head: The GOP Senator won’t interfere with a business decision. Good for him.
body:
Wisconsin Sen. Ron Johnson has some nerve. The Republican is refusing to bully Oshkosh Corp. to manufacture United States Postal Service trucks in his home state. He deserves a taxpayer commendation.
USPS last winter awarded Oshkosh a contract to build a new delivery fleet of up to 165,000 trucks to replace its 30-year-old clunkers. But a political backfire transpired after Oshkosh said it would build the trucks at a new factory in South Carolina, a right-to-work state. That makes it less likely that workers at the new plant will unionize.
